headline: Old Dominion leaning on cost controls, yield management amid tonnage declines
summary: Old Dominion Freight Line remains focused on yield management and controlling costs as it awaits a reprieve from tonnage declines. The post Old Dominion leaning on cost controls, yield management amid tonnage declines appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Compared to Estimates, Old Dominion (ODFL) Q3 Earnings: A Look at Key Metrics

headline: Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL) Q3 Earnings and Revenues Surpass Estimates
summary: Old Dominion (ODFL) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +4.92% and +0.70%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Old Dominion Freight Line’s (NASDAQ:ODFL) Q3 Earnings Results: Revenue In Line With Expectations
summary: Freight carrier Old Dominion (NASDAQ:ODFL) met Wall Streets revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales fell by 4.3% year on year to $1.41 billion. Its GAAP profit of $1.28 per share was 5.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Old Dominion: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: THOMASVILLE, N.C. (AP) — Old Dominion Freight Line Inc. ODFL) on Wednesday reported third-quarter earnings of $270.9 million. On a per-share basis, the Thomasville, North Carolina-based company said it had profit of $1.28.

headline: Old Dominion Freight Line Reports Third Quarter 2025 Earnings Per Diluted Share of $1.28
summary: THOMASVILLE, N.C., October 29, 2025--Old Dominion Freight Line, Inc. (Nasdaq: ODFL) today announced financial results for the three-month and nine-month periods ended September 30, 2025.
